data.enText: swore
sworn

data.chText: 咒骂；诅咒；说脏话
data.enText: to use rude or offensive language, usually because you are angry

data.chText: 她摔倒了，大骂了一声。
data.enText: She fell over and swore loudly.

data.chText: 你怎么听任他那么骂你呢？
data.enText: Why did you let him swear at you like that?

data.chText: 郑重承诺；发誓要；表示决心要
data.enText: to make a serious promise to do sth

data.chText: 他发誓要向那个杀死他父亲的人报仇。
data.enText: He swore revenge on the man who had killed his father.

data.chText: 我保证决不离开你。
data.enText: I swear (that) I'll never leave you.

data.text: ‘That’ is usually left out, especially in speech.
that常省略，在口语中尤其如此。

data.chText: 她要他发誓不告诉任何人。
data.enText: She made him swear not to tell anyone.

data.chText: 赌咒发誓地说；肯定地说
data.enText: to promise that you are telling the truth

data.chText: 她明确表示自己以前从未见过他。
data.enText: She swore (that) she'd never seen him before.

data.chText: 我敢肯定我听见电话铃响了。
data.enText: I could have sworn (= I am sure) I heard the phone ring.

data.chText: 我可以对天发誓，这跟我一点关系也没有。
data.enText: I swear to God I had nothing to do with it.

data.chText: （尤指在法庭上）发誓，郑重承诺
data.enText: to make a public or official promise, especially in court

data.chText: 证人须手按《圣经》宣誓。
data.enText: Witnesses were required to swear on the Bible.

data.chText: 你愿出庭起誓说你不认识他吗？
data.enText: Are you willing to stand up in court and swear that you don't recognize him?

data.chText: 别忘记，你宣过誓要讲实话。
data.enText: Remember, you have sworn to tell the truth.

data.chText: 贵族须宣誓效忠国王。
data.enText: Barons had to swear an oath of allegiance to the king.

data.chText: 使起誓（保密）
data.enText: to make sb promise not to tell sth to anyone

data.chText: 关于已发生的事，每个人都依照要求起誓不外传。
data.enText: Everyone was sworn to secrecy about what had happened.
swear blind

data.chText: 一口咬定
data.enText: to say that sth is definitely true
swear like a trooper

data.chText: 满口脏话；动不动就破口大骂
data.enText: to often use very rude or offensive language
swear by sb/sth

data.chText: 以…名义发誓；对…发誓
data.enText: to name sb/sth to show that you are making a serious promise

data.chText: 我向全能的上帝起誓，我以下所说句句属实。
data.enText: I swear by almighty God that I will tell the truth.

data.chText: 极信赖；对…推崇备至

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to be certain that sth is good or useful

data.chText: 她深信冥想有助于缓解压力。
data.enText: She swears by meditation as a way of relieving stress.
swear sb↔in
swear sb into sth

data.chText: 使某人宣誓就职；使某人宣誓忠于某组织（或国家等）
data.enText: to make sb promise to do a job correctly, to be loyal to an organization, a country, etc.

data.chText: 他宣誓就任总统。
data.enText: He was sworn in as president.

data.chText: 新首相宣誓就职。
data.enText: The new prime minister was sworn into office.
swear to sth

data.chText: 一口咬定
data.enText: to say that sth is definitely true

data.chText: 我觉得我把钥匙放回抽屉里了，不过我不敢肯定。
data.enText: I think I put the keys back in the drawer, but I couldn't swear to it (= I'm not completely sure) .

means: （尤指在法庭上）发誓，郑重承诺

ex.chText: 我可以保证他会还清债务的。
ex.enText: I can guarantee that he will pay off the debt.

ex.chText: 我不能保证天黑前完成那项工作。
ex.enText: I can't guarantee I will finish the work before dark.
The law guarantees equal rights for men and women.

synonyms.bx: 指以口头或书面形式作保证、担保、承诺，含若违背则予以补偿之意。

ex.chText: 我可以向你保证，你女儿在这里会很快乐的。
ex.enText: I can assure you that your daughter will be happy here.

ex.chText: 我们使游客确信准能过一个愉快的假期。
ex.enText: We assured the tourists of an enjoyable holiday.

synonyms.bx: 指用言语承诺某事一定会发生或一定是真实的，以消除他人的疑虑或担心。

ex.chText: 我用名誉担保她是清白无辜的。
ex.enText: I certify on my honour that she is innocent.

synonyms.bx: 较正式用词，指向他人保证某人或某事物可靠、没有问题等。

ex.enText: He promised to return the money to me.
He promised her that he would marry her.

synonyms.bx: 指保证一定会做某事或提供某物，或某事一定会发生，侧重于自己的主观意向，用言语使人感到放心。

ex.enText: He swore that he would get his revenge.

ex.chText: 我绝没有碰过他的钱包，我发誓！
ex.enText: I never touched his wallet, I swear!
He swore never to gamble again.

synonyms.bx: 指以发誓的形式作出保证，或强调自己所说的是真话。

data.enText: swear blind

data.chText: 一口咬定
data.enText: to say that sth is definitely true
swear like a trooper

data.chText: 满口脏话；动不动就破口大骂
data.enText: to often use very rude or offensive language
swear by sb/sth

data.chText: 以…名义发誓；对…发誓
data.enText: to name sb/sth to show that you are making a serious promise

data.chText: 我向全能的上帝起誓，我以下所说句句属实。
data.enText: I swear by almighty God that I will tell the truth.

data.chText: 极信赖；对…推崇备至

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to be certain that sth is good or useful

data.chText: 她深信冥想有助于缓解压力。
data.enText: She swears by meditation as a way of relieving stress.
swear sb↔in
swear sb into sth

data.chText: 使某人宣誓就职；使某人宣誓忠于某组织（或国家等）
data.enText: to make sb promise to do a job correctly, to be loyal to an organization, a country, etc.

data.chText: 他宣誓就任总统。
data.enText: He was sworn in as president.

data.chText: 新首相宣誓就职。
data.enText: The new prime minister was sworn into office.
swear to sth

data.chText: 一口咬定
data.enText: to say that sth is definitely true

data.chText: 我觉得我把钥匙放回抽屉里了，不过我不敢肯定。
data.enText: I think I put the keys back in the drawer, but I couldn't swear to it (= I'm not completely sure) .

example: I swear by my grandmother's recipes
The drunken men were cursing loudly in the street

tr: to declare or affirm solemnly and formally as true
example: Before God I swear I am innocent

value.def: If someone swears, they use language that is considered to be rude or offensive, usually because they are angry.

example.ex: It's wrong to swear and shout...
They swore at them and ran off.
example.tran: 他们骂了他们后就跑掉了。

value.def: If you swear to do something, you promise in a serious way that you will do it.

example.ex: Alan swore that he would do everything in his power to help us...
example.tran: 艾伦许诺要尽其所能帮助我们。

example.ex: We have sworn to fight cruelty wherever we find it...
The police are the only civil servants who have to swear allegiance to the Crown...
example.tran: 警察是唯一要宣誓效忠君主的公务员。

example.ex: I have sworn an oath to defend her.

value.def: If you say that you swear that something is true or that you can swear to it, you are saying very firmly that it is true.

example.ex: I swear I've told you all I know...
example.tran: 我发誓我已经把我所知道的全都告诉你了。

example.ex: I swear on all I hold dear that I had nothing to do with this...
example.tran: 我以身家性命担保，我和这件事无关。

example.ex: Behind them was a confusion of noise, perhaps even a shot, but he couldn't swear to it.
example.tran: 他们身后响起一片嘈杂声，也许还有枪击声，但他不能确定。

value.tran: 发誓，郑重声明，保证(所说属实)

value.def: If someone is sworn to secrecy or is sworn to silence, they promise another person that they will not reveal a secret.

example.ex: She was bursting to announce the news but was sworn to secrecy.
example.tran: 她急不可待想宣布这个消息，但却发过誓要守口如瓶。

value.tran: 使发誓，使承诺(保守秘密)
